newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine An-70, An-140 test planes ready soon.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine An-70, An-140 test planes ready soon.

text.p: Ukraine's Antonov airplane designer and manufacturer is to complete work on models of its latest An-70 and An-140 transport aircraft by the end of the year, a top company official was quoted as saying on Monday.
Anatoly Dubovenko, head of Antonov's technical and scientific department, told Ukrinform news agency's business weekly that both models were almost ready.
"Once we receive some equipment we need, flights will be possible at the end of the year," he said.
Dubovenko said 10 million hryvnia ($5.7 million) were needed to buy radio-electronic equipment from Russia to complete the An-70.
Financing for the model, with a capacity of 35 tonnes, is provided by Antonov and a joint Ukrainian-Russian consortium.
Ukrainian authorities have banked on the export potential of the An-70, whose prototype was completed in 1994 but crashed on a test flight a year later outside Kiev.
Officials blamed the crash on an aircraft accompanying the An-70 during the flight.
Antonov will be able to produce 24 An-70s annually.

The 52-seat short-haul turbo-prop An-140 is to replace the ageing An-24, substantial numbers of which are still operating in the former Soviet Union and other countries. The plane will be able to carry 4.9 tonnes of cargo.
The financing of the An-140 has been from the state budget.
Earlier this year Ukraine won a tender from Iran to build a plant there, capable of producing ten An-140 planes yearly.
